title: Standing Wave Leaves Fish Stranded in Shallow Water as Dorian Hits
text:
Strong winds caused a standing wave to form in Pamlico Sound in North Carolina’s Outer Banks, stranding fish in shallow pools as the beach on Hatteras Island was left almost empty of water, after Hurricane Dorian made landfall on September 6.

Jenni Koontz, who filmed this footage, said that, after the eye of the hurricane passed the island, “the wind completely dropped out and the Pamlico Sound went dry. The wind then suddenly picked up to gusts of 100mph.”

Hurricane Dorian made landfall on Cape Hatteras on September 6 with maximum sustained wind speeds of 90mph.

The National Weather Service issued a flash-flood emergency for several areas in North Carolina’s Outer Banks.

The National Hurricane Center said on Friday morning that floodwater on Hatteras Island, northeast of Ocracoke Island, was more than five feet high. Credit: Jenni Koontz via Storyful
